job_title: Revenue Cycle Specialist in West Lebanon, NH
pros: Good staff and leadership at ApD
cons: None at this time to report

pros: They offer Good benefits, flexible schedule,
cons: Too much turnover in Human resources and lack of support

review_title: Great people and friendly work environment.
pros: I work in the Harvest Hill assisted living community. The people living there and the employees are both incredibly friendly. I've worked both first and second shifts, and while it can be tiring at times due to occasional fast-paced work, it's definitely very rewarding. A lot can be learned from interacting with the residents, and the nursing and management staff are all very friendly with each other.
cons: None other than what you'd get from any job working in some kind of food service. Sometimes there are timing conflicts or shortages in food. At points you'll have to wait longer than expected to get your table's food, and you might be thrown off. Nothing different than you'd expect from most places working at similar jobs. The welcoming environment and friendly people usually help to mitigate this. Overall, one of the best jobs I've had.
Outsourcing of positions in revenue cycle
